page.title: 05LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: The church has been recorded back to 1111.The church was built in Norman times but the tower was rebuilt in 1658.Clyst Hydon used to be called Clyst Tona.William the Conqueror gave John Hydon all that he could see from the top of a hill called Hydon hill. John Hydon could see Clyst Hydon and Clay Hydon.John Hydon built a castle called Hydon castle.He had two twin daughters.John Reynold married one of the daughters and James Huyshe married the other daughter.When John Hydon died John Huyshe son of James Huyshe became the patron of Clyst Hydon and owned most of the land around it.In 1794 John Huyshe sold a stain glass window from the church to the manor lodge.Thefont in the church dates back to Norman times.It used to be one of the three fonts in the country that was built into the wall.
